verses.text: 列國為甚麼騷動？萬民為甚麼空謀妄想？

words.note: A four-character idiom (成語) describing pointless plotting.

verses.text: 世上的君王起來，首領聚在一起，敵對耶和華和他所膏立的，說：

words.note: Transliteration of the Hebrew divine name.
Often indicates the object of a verb or a passive construction.
Here used nominally, referring to the anointed one.

verses.text: 「我們來掙斷他們給我們的束縛，擺脫他們的繩索！」

words.note: Can indicate an imperative or suggestion.
Indicates the agent or recipient.

verses.text: 那坐在天上的必發笑，主必譏笑他們。

words.note: Functions here as a demonstrative pronoun, referring to 'the one who'.
Stronger than 'will', indicating certainty.
Stronger than 'will', indicating certainty.

verses.text: 那時，他必在烈怒中對他們講話，在震怒中使他們驚慌，說：

words.note: Stronger than 'will', indicating certainty.

verses.text: 「我已經在錫安我的聖山上，立了我的君王。」

words.note: Used as a locative suffix here

verses.text: 受膏者說：「我要宣告耶和華的諭旨：耶和華對我說：『你是我的兒子，我今日生了你。

words.note: Refers to the Messiah.
More formal/literary than 今天 (jīntiān).

verses.text: 你求我，我就把列國賜給你作產業，把全地都歸屬於你。
你必用鐵杖擊打他們，好像打碎陶器一樣粉碎他們。』」
現在，君王啊！你們要謹慎。地上的審判官啊！你們應當聽勸告。
你們要以敬畏的態度事奉耶和華，又應當存戰兢的心而歡呼。

words.note: Refers to reverent fear of God.
Specifically serving a superior or God.
Often used for awe or fear before God.

verses.text: 你們要用嘴親吻子，否則他一發怒，你們就在路上滅亡，因為他的怒氣快要發作。凡是投靠他的，都是有福的。

words.note: In biblical context, can mean to show homage or reverence.
Refers to 'the Son' (of God).
Used with '就' (jiù) to mean 'as soon as... then...'
Can refer to divine wrath in religious texts.
Used with '一' (yī) to mean 'as soon as... then...'

words.definition: on the way, on the road

words.note: Often implies utter destruction, especially spiritual.
Refers to anger, often specifically God's anger.
Can refer to a sudden onset of something, like anger or illness.
Often used for seeking refuge or trusting in God.
Forms a noun phrase from the preceding clause: 'those who trust him'.
Refers to receiving divine blessing.
Emphasizes or confirms the predicate, similar to 'indeed'.
